Name: New Providence
Description: The most populous island and economic hub, home to the capital city, Nassau.

Name: Grand Bahama
Description: A major tourist and industrial center, known for Freeport and its natural parks.

Name: Abaco Islands
Description: A group of islands and cays popular for boating, fishing, and tourism.

Name: Andros
Description: The largest island, known for its blue holes, marine biodiversity, and eco-tourism.

Name: Eleuthera
Description: A long and narrow island famous for its pink sand beaches and historical settlements.

Name: Exuma
Description: A chain of 365 cays known for crystal-clear waters, luxury resorts, and marine life.

Name: Berry Islands
Description: A small cluster of cays known for exclusive resorts and deep-sea fishing.

Name: Bimini
Description: The westernmost district, closest to Florida, known for fishing and historical sites.

Name: Cat Island
Description: A sparsely populated island known for Mount Alvernia, the highest point in The Bahamas.

Name: San Salvador
Description: Believed to be the first landfall of Christopher Columbus in the New World.

Name: Acklins
Description: A remote island known for its pristine natural environment and bonefishing.

Name: Crooked Island
Description: A quiet island with historical ruins and unspoiled beaches.

Name: Inagua
Description: A nature lover s paradise, home to the Inagua National Park and flamingo populations.

Name: Long Island
Description: Famous for Dean s Blue Hole, one of the world s deepest blue holes.

Name: Mayaguana
Description: A remote island with a small population, offering untouched beaches and nature.

Name: Ragged Island
Description: A small island with a tiny population, known for its salt ponds and fishing.
